intro: Xeroloma, commonly known as the desert bell, is a genus of flowering plants native to arid regions of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its succulent leaves and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plants are adapted to survive in dry environments, storing water in their thick, fleshy stems and leaves. Xeroloma species often have a compact growth habit and are popular in xeriscaping due to their low water requirements. They are also valued for their ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in challenging climates.
